ooc: any factions in particular needing members?

--Rukus--

Rukus tests out his joints by twirling his arms a bit. They moved 
efficiently, and without any hinderance. His black armour glistened 
in the sun as he moved his arms.

Peering back into his pod, he checks the readings. He didn't read it 
wrong, according to the computer, this was ancient Terra, and he had 
landed near a lake on the eastern side of a chain of mountains in a 
oddly shaped continent. Apparently most of this planet was made up 
of a molecule made up of two hydrogen atoms, and an oxygen atom - 
named water by the original inhabitants. He thought that it must 
have been somewhat lucky he landed on one of the land masses then.

Reaching for the communication system in the pod, he scans a few 
short-wave and long-wave radio frequencies, and then when he found 
nothing, he ran a search for laser beam transmissions. Again he came 
up with nothing, and he began to wonder whether he was the only one 
from the station who had arrived here. 

Since he couldn't pick up any signals, he decided to make his own 
and see what happened, there was intelligent life on this planet or 
so the history said, but who knows, maybe someone could help him. He 
reconfigured the comm unit to broadcast a short-wave, long-wave, and 
laser beam transmission help call, then he started looking for 
somewhere to hide.

"Beast Mode." He said purposefully, as if he'd known he could say 
this and have something happen his whole life. His torso twirled and 
his arms and legs folded slightly and soon he was no longer the 
serious looking black and white biped he had been not too long ago. 
He was now a large quadraped, a hybrid of a black wolf, and a white 
snow fox - but it was obvious that the wolf side had remained 
dominant.

"Must be part of the mode scanner's work... but it did a good job, 
the manoverability of this form is amazing!" He says quietly to 
himself, as he leaps onto a large rock, and lets loose a haunting 
howl. 

A soldier must always adapt to the situation, Rukus was no exception.


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Jeff" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> --Rukus--
> 
> The pod screamed across the sky, blazing a trail right through the 
> clouds as it made it's way down to the planet. Beside punching a 
> hole through a flock of birds which were unfortunate enough to be 
in 
> the path of the fireball, the initial part of the decent was 
> uneventful. The landing was somewhat more interesting.
> 
> The pod came down somewhat hard, but as luck had it, it glanced 
off 
> of a lake and rolled for about a kilometre knocking down a few 
trees 
> before coming to a rest in an upright position in a snow patch. 
Base 
> scanners showed the pod landing in the Rocky Mountains near a 
> smallish lake around the US-Canada (locations with reference to 
the 
> future's locations). A scanning device popped up out of the top of 
> the pod, and proceeded to scan the area.
> 
> The scanning device selected two life forms it picked up: a black 
> wolf, and a white and black fox. The computer melded the two forms 
> together, choosing the black wolf as the dominate side, and then 
> outputed a digital 3 dimentional view of the transformation mode 
to 
> the pods occupant.
> 
> The pod was then silent for a few minutes, and some of the 
wildlife 
> started to casually walk away, ignoring it. Then suddenly there 
was 
> a hissing noise that came from the pod. The front fireshield 
raised 
> slowly as a moderate amount of mist spewed out of the once sealed 
> chamber. As the mist finished emptying itself, a mostly black bot 
> with some white parts stepped out and looked around.
